  3/** @file    vsip/domain.hpp

  9    specified in the [domain] section of the VSIPL++ specification.

 13#define VSIP_DOMAIN_HPP

 19#include <vsip/support.hpp>
 20#include <vsip/core/vertex.hpp>

 22namespace vsip
 23{
 24
 25template <dimension_type D> struct Index;
 26
 27template <> class Index<1> : public Vertex<index_type, 1>
 28{
 29public:
 30  Index() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 31  Index(index_type x) VSIP_NOTHROW : Vertex<index_type, 1>(x) {}
 32};
 33
 34// mathematical operations for Index
 35
 36template <dimension_type Dim>
 37inline bool 
 38operator==(Index<Dim> const& i, Index<Dim> const& j) VSIP_NOTHROW
 39{
 40  for (dimension_type d=0; d<Dim; ++d)
 41    if (i[d] != j[d])
 42      return false;
 43  return true;
 44}
 45
 46
 47
 48// Specialize for Index<1>.  This is identical to the template
 49// operator==, but it allows implicit conversions to be considered.
 50// In particular, it allows Index<1> values to be compared with
 51// index_type values.
 52
 53inline bool 
 54operator==(Index<1> const& i, Index<1> const& j) VSIP_NOTHROW
 55{
 56  return i[0] == j[0];
 57}
 58
 59
 60
 61template <dimension_type Dim>
 62inline
 63Index<Dim>
 64operator-(
 65  Index<Dim> const& op1,
 66  Index<Dim> const& op2)
 67{
 68  Index<Dim> res;
 69  for (dimension_type d=0; d<Dim; ++d)
 70    res[d] = op1[d] - op2[d];
 71  return res;
 72}
 73
 74
 75
 76template <dimension_type Dim>
 77inline
 78Index<Dim>
 79operator+(
 80  Index<Dim> const& op1,
 81  Index<Dim> const& op2)
 82{
 83  Index<Dim> res;
 84  for (dimension_type d=0; d<Dim; ++d)
 85    res[d] = op1[d] + op2[d];
 86  return res;
 87}
 88
 89
 90template <> class Index<2> : public Vertex<index_type, 2>
 91{
 92public:
 93  Index() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
 94  Index(index_type x, index_type y) VSIP_NOTHROW 
 95  : Vertex<index_type, 2>(x, y) {}
 96};
 97
 98template <> class Index<3> : public Vertex<index_type, 3>
 99{
100public:
101  Index() VSIP_NOTHROW {}
102  Index(index_type x, index_type y, index_type z) VSIP_NOTHROW 
103  : Vertex<index_type, 3>(x, y, z) {}
104};
105
106/***********************************************************************
107  Declarations
108***********************************************************************/
109
110/// A Domain is a non-empty set of non-negative indexes.
111//
112/// Validation checks are only performed in Domain<1> constructors,
113/// since Domain<D> is expressed in terms of Domain<1> and all modifying
114/// operations on domains are expressed by assigning new Domain<1> objects.
115
116template <dimension_type D> class Domain;
117
118template <>
119class Domain<1>
120{
121public:
122  static dimension_type const dim = 1;
123
124  Domain() VSIP_NOTHROW
125    : index_(0), stride_(1), length_(1) { }
126  Domain(index_type i, stride_type s, length_type len) VSIP_NOTHROW
127    : index_(i), stride_(s), length_(len) { assert(this->impl_is_valid()); }
128  Domain(length_type len) VSIP_NOTHROW
129    : index_(0), stride_(1), length_(len) { assert(this->impl_is_valid()); }
130  Domain(Domain const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW
131    : index_(d.index_), stride_(d.stride_), length_(d.length_) { }
132  Domain<1> const& operator[](dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
133    { assert(d == 0); return *this; } 
134
135  Domain<1>& impl_at(dimension_type d) VSIP_NOTHROW
136    { assert(d == 0); return *this; } 
137
138  // these are defined explicitly just so we can paste on VSIP_NOTHROW.
139 
140  Domain& operator=(Domain const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW;
141
142  bool element_conformant(Domain<1> const& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW;
143  bool product_conformant(Domain<2> const&) const VSIP_NOTHROW
144    { return false; }
145
146  index_type  first()  const VSIP_NOTHROW { return this->index_;}
147  stride_type stride() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return this->stride_;}
148  length_type length() const VSIP_NOTHROW { return this->length_;}
149  length_type size()   const VSIP_NOTHROW { return this->length_;}
150
151  // These functions are an extension to the specs.  impl_nth() is not
152  // operator[] because operator[] needs to remain the identity function
153  // for convenience when writing cross-dimensional templates.
154
155  index_type impl_nth(index_type const i) const VSIP_NOTHROW
156    {
157      // We need to do the multiplication using signed arithmetic,
158      // because the stride may be negative.  The addition can happen
159      // in unsigned arithmetic; if the stride is negative, conversion
160      // will produce a very large number and the unsigned sum will
161      // wrap around to the value we want.  (C++ guarantees this
162      // property for unsigned arithmetic, see [conv.integral] and
163      // [basic.fundamental]/4.)
164
165      return this->index_ + this->stride_ * static_cast<stride_type>(i);
166    }
167  index_type impl_last() const VSIP_NOTHROW
168    { return this->impl_nth(this->length() - 1); }
169
170  /// A Domain is valid if it is non-empty and non-negative.
171  inline bool impl_is_valid() const VSIP_NOTHROW;
172
173  // These are used to implement [domains.arithmetic].
174 
175  inline void impl_add_in(index_difference_type s) VSIP_NOTHROW;
176  inline void impl_sub_out(index_difference_type s) VSIP_NOTHROW;
177  inline void impl_mul_by(stride_scalar_type s) VSIP_NOTHROW;
178  inline void impl_div_by(stride_scalar_type s) VSIP_NOTHROW;
179
180  inline bool impl_equals(Domain const&) const VSIP_NOTHROW;
181
182  enum impl_No_init { impl_no_init };
183  Domain(Domain::impl_No_init) VSIP_NOTHROW { }
184
185private:
186  index_type  index_;
187  stride_type stride_;
188  length_type length_;
189};
190
191inline Domain<1>& 
192Domain<1>::operator=(Domain const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW
193{
194  this->index_ = d.index_;
195  this->stride_ = d.stride_;
196  this->length_ = d.length_;
197  return *this;
198}
199
200inline bool 
201Domain<1>::impl_is_valid() const VSIP_NOTHROW 
202{
203  // As the stride can be negative, we have to test whether 
204  // the upper end-point is greater than or equal to zero.
205  return(this->size() == 0
206         || (this->size() > 0 &&
207	     static_cast<stride_type>(this->impl_last()) >= 0));
208}
209
210#define VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER(Mem,Arg,Datum,Assign_op) \
211  inline void \
212  Domain<1>::Mem(Arg const a) VSIP_NOTHROW \
213  { \
214    this->Datum Assign_op a; \
215    assert(this->impl_is_valid()); \
216  }
217
218VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER(impl_add_in, index_difference_type, index_, +=)
219VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER(impl_sub_out, index_difference_type, index_, -=)
220VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER(impl_mul_by, stride_scalar_type, stride_, *=)
221VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER(impl_div_by, stride_scalar_type, stride_, /=)
222
223#undef VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOM1_MEMBER
224
225
226inline bool 
227Domain<1>::element_conformant(Domain<1> const& d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
228{ return this->length() == d.length(); }
229
230inline bool 
231Domain<1>::impl_equals(Domain const& d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
232{
233  return this->length() == d.length() &&
234    ((this->stride() == d.stride() && this->first() == d.first()) ||
235     (this->stride() == -d.stride() && 
236      this->first() == d.first() + (d.length() - 1) * d.stride()));
237}
238
239
240namespace impl
241{
242
243// definitions of Op types to pass to Vec_mem_op_scalar
244#define VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ(Tag, Op, Arg) \
245  struct Tag \
246  { \
247    static void apply(Domain<1>& dom, const Arg u) VSIP_NOTHROW \
248      { dom.Op(u); } \
249  }
250
251VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ(Add_in,  impl_add_in, index_difference_type);
252VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ(Sub_out, impl_sub_out, index_difference_type);
253VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ(Mul_by,  impl_mul_by, stride_scalar_type);
254VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ(Div_by,  impl_div_by, stride_scalar_type);
255
256#undef VSIP_IMPL_DEF_OP_OBJ
257
258////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
259// Vec_mem_op_scalar: recursively apply a modifying operation and 
260// an argument to elements of an array.
261
262template <typename Op, typename Arg1, typename Arg2, dimension_type D>
263struct Vec_mem_op_scalar
264{
265  static void apply(Arg1* const dom, Arg2 d) VSIP_NOTHROW
266    { Op::apply(*dom, d);
267      Vec_mem_op_scalar<Op,Arg1,Arg2,D-1>::apply(dom + 1, d); }
268};
269
270template <typename Op, typename Arg1, typename Arg2>
271  struct Vec_mem_op_scalar<Op,Arg1,Arg2,0>
272{ 
273  static void apply(Arg1*, Arg2) VSIP_NOTHROW { }
274};
275
276////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
277
278struct Equal
279{
280  static bool apply(Domain<1> const& a, Domain<1> const& b) VSIP_NOTHROW 
281    { return a.impl_equals(b); }
282};
283
284struct Conforms
285{
286  static bool apply(Domain<1> const& a, Domain<1> const& b) VSIP_NOTHROW 
287    { return a.element_conformant(b); }
288};
289
290////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
291// Vec_mem_pred: recursively apply a member predicate to corresponding
292//   elements of vectors, short-circuiting the result.
293
294template <typename Pred, typename Arg, dimension_type D>
295  struct Vec_mem_pred
296{
297  static bool apply(Arg* const a, Arg* const b) VSIP_NOTHROW
298    { return Pred::apply(*a, *b) &&
299        Vec_mem_pred<Pred,Arg,D-1>::apply(a + 1, b + 1); }
300};
301
302template <typename Pred, typename Arg>
303  struct Vec_mem_pred<Pred,Arg,0>
304{ 
305  static bool apply(Arg*, Arg*) VSIP_NOTHROW { return true; }
306};
307
308
309////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
310// Vec_copy: recursively corresponding elements of vectors.
311
312template <typename Arg, dimension_type D>
313struct Vec_copy
314{
315  static void apply(Arg* const a, Arg const* const b) VSIP_NOTHROW
316    { *a = *b;
317      Vec_copy<Arg,D-1>::apply(a + 1, b + 1); }
318};
319
320template <typename Arg>
321struct Vec_copy<Arg,1>
322{
323  static void apply(Arg* const a, Arg const* const b) VSIP_NOTHROW
324    { *a = *b; }
325};
326
327////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
328// vec_domain_size: return product of sizes of D Domain<1>s.
329
330template <dimension_type Dim>
331inline length_type 
332vec_domain_size(Domain<1> const* const d) VSIP_NOTHROW
333  { return d->size() * vec_domain_size<Dim-1>(d + 1); }
334
335template <>
336inline length_type 
337vec_domain_size<1>(Domain<1> const* const d) VSIP_NOTHROW
338  { return d->size(); }
339
340////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
341
342// Domain1n is just like a Domain<1> except its default constructor
343// doesn't initialize it (that's what the "n" stands for).  Used for 
344// the array member Domain_base<D>::domains_[D].
345
346struct Domain1n : Domain<1>
347{
348  Domain1n() VSIP_NOTHROW : Domain<1>(Domain<1>::impl_no_init) { }
349  Domain1n(Domain1n const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW : Domain<1>(d) { }
350  Domain1n& operator=(Domain<1> const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW
351    { Domain<1>::operator=(d); return *this; }
352};
353
354template <dimension_type D>
355struct Domain_base
356{
357  static dimension_type const dim = D;
358
359  Domain_base() VSIP_NOTHROW { }  // leave members uninited!
360  Domain_base(const Domain_base& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW;
361
362  Domain<1> const& operator[](dimension_type d) const VSIP_NOTHROW
363    { assert(d < D); return this->domains_[d]; }
364
365  Domain<1>& impl_at(dimension_type d) VSIP_NOTHROW
366    { assert(d < D); return this->domains_[d]; } 
367
368  length_type size() const VSIP_NOTHROW
369    { return vec_domain_size<D>(this->domains_); }
370
371  bool impl_equals(Domain_base<D> const& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW;
372
373  bool element_conformant(const Domain<D>& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW
374    { return Vec_mem_pred<Conforms,const Domain1n,D>::apply(
375               this->domains_, dom.domains_); }
376
377  bool product_conformant(const Domain<2>& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW;
378
379  void operator=(Domain_base<D> const& d) VSIP_NOTHROW
380    { Vec_copy<Domain1n,D>::apply(this->domains_, d.domains_); }
381
382  #define VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE(Op,Arg,Op_type) \
383  inline void Op(Arg const d) VSIP_NOTHROW \
384    { Vec_mem_op_scalar<Op_type,Domain1n,const Arg,D>::apply( \
385        this->domains_, d); }
386
387  // These are used to implement [domains.arithmetic].
388  VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE(impl_add_in, index_difference_type, Add_in)
389  VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE(impl_sub_out, index_difference_type, Sub_out)
390  VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE(impl_mul_by, stride_scalar_type, Mul_by)
391  VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE(impl_div_by, stride_scalar_type, Div_by)
392
393  #undef VSIP_IMPL_DEF_UPDATE
394
395  Domain1n domains_[dim];
396};
397
398
399template <dimension_type D>
400inline 
401Domain_base<D>::Domain_base(const Domain_base& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW
402{ Vec_copy<Domain1n,D>::apply(this->domains_, dom.domains_); }
403
404template <dimension_type D>
405bool
406Domain_base<D>::impl_equals(Domain_base<D> const& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW
407{
408  return Vec_mem_pred<Equal,const Domain1n,D>::apply(
409    this->domains_, dom.domains_);
410}
411
412
413
414// Return size of dimension.
415
416// Generic function.  Overloaded for structures that can encode
417// extents (Domain, Length)
418
419template <dimension_type D>
420inline length_type
421size_of_dim(Domain<D> const& len, dimension_type d)
422{
423  return len[d].size();
424}
425
426} // namespace impl
427
428
429// We have to specialize Domain<D> for various D explicitly just
430// so we can declare the special constructors.
431
432template <> 
433class Domain<2> : public impl::Domain_base<2>
434{
435public:
436  Domain() VSIP_NOTHROW
437    { this->domains_[0] = this->domains_[1] = Domain<1>(); }
438  Domain(const Domain<1>& d0, const Domain<1>& d1) VSIP_NOTHROW 
439    { this->domains_[0] = d0; this->domains_[1] = d1; }
440  Domain(const Domain& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW 
441    : impl::Domain_base<2>(dom) { }
442  Domain& operator=(Domain const& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW
443    { impl::Domain_base<2>::operator=(dom); return *this; } 
444};
445
446template <> 
447class Domain<3> : public impl::Domain_base<3>
448{
449public:
450  Domain() VSIP_NOTHROW;
451  Domain(const Domain<1>&, const Domain<1>&, const Domain<1>&) VSIP_NOTHROW;
452  Domain(const Domain& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW : impl::Domain_base<3>(dom) { }
453  Domain& operator=(Domain const& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW
454    { impl::Domain_base<3>::operator=(dom); return *this; } 
455};
456
457inline
458Domain<3>::Domain() VSIP_NOTHROW
459{ this->domains_[0] = this->domains_[1] = this->domains_[2] = Domain<1>(); }
460
461inline
462Domain<3>::Domain(
463  const Domain<1>& d0,
464  const Domain<1>& d1,
465  const Domain<1>& d2) VSIP_NOTHROW
466{
467  domains_[0] = d0;
468  domains_[1] = d1;
469  domains_[2] = d2;
470}
471
472template <dimension_type D>
473inline bool
474impl::Domain_base<D>::product_conformant(
475  Domain<2> const& dom) const VSIP_NOTHROW
476{
477  // note: this is OK because Domain<1> has its own, specialized definition.
478  return D == 2 && this->domains_[1].length() == dom.domains_[0].length();
479}
480
481/***********************************************************************
482  Globals
483***********************************************************************/
484
485/// [domains.index.equality]
486/// Domain<D>s can be compared for equality and inequality.  Two
487/// Domain<D>s are equal if and only if they contain exactly the same
488/// Index<D>es.
489
490template <dimension_type D> 
491inline bool
492operator==(const Domain<D>& d1, const Domain<D>& d2) VSIP_NOTHROW
493  { return d1.impl_equals(d2); }
494
495template <dimension_type D>
496inline bool 
497operator!=(Domain<D> const& d0, Domain<D> const& d1) VSIP_NOTHROW
498{ return !operator==(d0, d1); }
499
500#define VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP(Op,Arg,Mem) \
501  template <dimension_type D> \
502  inline const Domain<D> \
503  operator Op(Domain<D> const& dom, const Arg a) VSIP_NOTHROW \
504  { \
505    Domain<D> retn(dom); \
506    retn.Mem(a); \
507    return retn;   \
508  }
509VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP(+, index_difference_type, impl_add_in)
510VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP(-, index_difference_type, impl_sub_out)
511VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP(*, stride_scalar_type, impl_mul_by)
512VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP(/, stride_scalar_type, impl_div_by)
513
514#undef VSIP_IMPL_DEF_DOMAIN_OP
515
516template <dimension_type D>
517inline const Domain<D>
518operator+(index_difference_type diff, Domain<D> const& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW
519{ return dom + diff; }
520
521template <dimension_type D>
522inline const Domain<D>
523operator*(stride_scalar_type s, Domain<D> const& dom) VSIP_NOTHROW
524{ return dom * s; }
525
